title: Ticket #4249: condor_q extremely large memory usage
description:
Currently, dprintf buffers all statements until 'dprintf_config' is called.

For a tool (condor_q), this never happens so the buffer grows indefinitely. When using "-userlog" mode, there's 2 log lines per event (one for locking and one for unlocking). In my testing, this caused >100MB of RAM to be used by a condor_q invocation.

For now, the workaround is to add the "-debug" flag and pipe stderr to /dev/null. This causes dprintf_config and prevents the buffering.
